sentence.idiomatic: You're really lucky to find such a good job.
You are all more fortunate than me. Up till now, I still don't have a girlfriend.
She is a good woman. It was my good fortune to meet her.
Lately my luck hasn't been too good. I can't succeed at anything.
These past few days your luck has been so good, you should go to Macao.
I have no way of knowing if your luck will be good or bad next year.
You can eat the most authentic Xinjiang food here.
The way you do Taichi is kind of strange. It doesn't seem to be the orthodox method.
There is so much fake merchandise these days. Where can one buy purses that are both genuine and cheap?
This clothing looks quite nice, but the material isn't very good.
I haven't seen you in years, and you haven't changed a bit. You are so youthful still.
What is your new mobile phone like?
The potato chips were left out for a day, and aren't crispy. They don't taste good.
I like to eat crispy apples.
This girl's voice is very crisp--perfect for singing this song.
Last week my mother and I got our fortunes told.
What did the fortune teller say?
People can alter their own destiny. That's why I don't believe in fortune tellers.
Next year we will be able to export our product overseas.
He has a clothing export business.
Products that are exported must go through strict inspection.
I am finally able to earn my own money.
I heard that he made a lot of money from opening that store.
Do you know what kind of business is somewhat lucrative?
Where do the most authentic fortune cookies come from?
What cookies?
Fortune cookies. It's the most famous Chinese dessert!
I've never heard of them. Where did you eat them?
All the Chinese restaurants in America have them.
They definitely don't have them in China. Are they good?
They are shaped like a dumpling, and are crispy and sweet. Inside there is a piece of paper, and it has your fortune written on it.
Like getting your fortune told. Very interesting.
Wow, export those to China, and you would definitely make money.
Uh...
